title: How to Bake Chicken Thighs in the Oven

methods.name: Baked Chicken Thighs with Root Vegetables

steps.headline: Wash the chicken.
steps.description: Rinse the chicken thighs in cold water. Trim dangling pieces of fat and skin. Pat the chicken dry using paper towels.

steps.headline: Set a dutch oven over medium-high heat.
steps.description: Add the olive oil to the pot.

steps.headline: Brown the chicken.
steps.description: Place the chicken pieces skin-side down into the dutch oven. Cook them for three to minutes, then turn them over using a pair of tongs and cook on the other side for three minutes. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.

steps.headline: Add the onion, root vegetables of your choice, and garlic to the dutch oven.
steps.description: Pile the vegetables around the chicken, taking care not to cover the chicken entirely. Sprinkle the mixture liberally with salt and pepper, and place the lid on the dutch oven.

steps.headline: Bake the chicken and vegetables.
steps.description: Place the lidded dutch oven in the preheated oven. Bake for 30 minutes. Remove from the oven and take off the lid.

steps.headline: Return the chicken and vegetables to the oven.
steps.description: Bake for another 15 minutes, until the chicken skin is golden brown and the vegetables are thoroughly cooked. Chicken meat is done when its internal temperature has reached 165 degrees. Use a meat thermometer to check for doneness.

steps.headline: Serve the chicken and vegetables with a green salad or the side dish of your choice.

methods.name: Baked Chicken Thighs with Honey Garlic Glaze

steps.headline: Wash the chicken.
steps.description: Rinse the chicken thighs in cold water. Trim dangling pieces of fat and skin. Pat the chicken dry using paper towels.

steps.headline: Set a dutch oven over medium heat.
Brown the chicken.
steps.description: Place the chicken thighs skin-side down in the heated olive oil. Cook for three minutes. Turn the chicken pieces and cook on the other side for three minutes. Sprinkle the chicken with salt and pepper. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.

steps.headline: Bake the chicken.
steps.description: Put the lid on the dutch oven and place it in the oven. Bake the chicken for 30 minutes.

steps.headline: Make the honey garlic glaze.
steps.description: While the chicken is baking, set a small saucepan on the stove over medium heat. Add the garlic, honey, soy sauce, and cayenne pepper. Bring to a light simmer and turn off the heat.

steps.headline: Glaze the chicken.
steps.description: Remove the chicken from the oven. Pour the honey garlic glaze over the chicken, covering every piece.

steps.headline: Return the chicken to the oven.
steps.description: Place the dutch oven back in the oven without a lid. Bake the chicken for an additional 15 minutes, or until the skin is brown and crispy. Use a meat thermometer to test the chicken for doneness.

steps.headline: Serve with rice and vegetables, or the side dishes of your choice.
